revolution.translation[0].definitions[0]: a complete change in ways of thinking, methods of working etc
the biggest social revolution we have had in this country
In the last ten years there has been a revolution in education.
revolution.translation[0].definitions[1]: a time when people change a ruler or political system by using force or violence
The role of women has changed since the revolution.
The country seems to be heading towards revolution.
revolution.translation[0].definitions[2]: the planetsâ€™ revolution around the Sun
revolution.translation[0].definitions[3]: one complete circular spinning movement, made by something such as a wheel attached to a central point
a speed of 100 revolutions per minute
revolution.translation[0].note_box[0].se: an attempt by a large group of people at revolution
a popular uprising (=involving ordinary people, not the army)
an occasion when a group of people, especially soldiers, suddenly take control of a country
revolution.translation[1].definitions[0]: a complete change in ways of thinking, methods of working etc
Computer technology has caused a revolution in working practices.
